intro: Pimpinella tongloensis, commonly known as the Tonglo angelica, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has a preference for moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered together, and it produces small, dark brown fruits. Pimpinella tongloensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
